author: lucasmac9
title: Bringing E.A Investors to Cardano
description: It's hard for people outside crypto to enter into this industry. The Space is saturated with Misleading projects and high risk investments.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is an interesting idea which aims to provide traditional investors access to innovative investments with Cardano based tokens through a crowdfunding platform. As the authors mention, this platform is product of the team’s project which got funded in Fund7, the team are currently developing the first MVP and the platform will be releases in June 2022 with the goal is for all investors. However, they realize East Asia is the potential region where there are many voters come from, so that their platform jumps to target East Asian investors.
In my opinion, the proposal fits with the challenge very well because if it is successful, it will attract investors from East Asia, increase the number of active Cardano wallets , attract people outside the Cardano community come to know about Catalyst Project. Therefore, it certainly adds big value to Cardano ecosystem and helps to grow Catalyst Project.
f6_assessments.q1: The author provides information of the project in details to make it feasible: The plan is described succinctly to tell what need to be done in chronological order; The budget is broken down clearly into identifiable items, allows us to know what the money is asking for and how much for each of them; The team who build the project is provide in details about their names, their professional majors, how many experienced years they have, their skills and experience related to the successful conducting of the proposal, with Linkedln of each member. Clearly we have a committed team of Catalyst Project: two cofounders of the LATAM Cardano Community, CA, vCA, funded proposers with links of previous winning proposals included. The authors also foresee the challenges/risks that they will face when conducting the project, that allows readers to understand more about the project. I found intersting with watching the short video which introduces the Token Allies platform, I believe the proposal will be successful implemented with all the information given. However, I see in the plan of the proposal, the activities are listed in 1st week, 1st month and 2nd month, but the budget is asking for 3 months. Is this the typing mistake or I missing something?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers describe what success look like in details, that give us the necessary content to establish tracking. We can audit the proposal based on the information provided in the KPIs section. About the results, it is possible to track them through the section " What does success for this project look like? ". Or I can say, the proposers give us with enough material to understand what would happen, how it would happen, in which order and what final products.

f6_assessments.q0: Cryptocurrency investment scams have recorded on many platforms and this has made a majority of investment skeptical to put in it resources. This can be reversed with time but there still many more who trust powerful and blockchain innovation financing.
f6_assessments.q1:
The budget is detailed and showing how the monies would be disbursed. Looking at the action plans to be executed, the requested amount is reasonable and there are timelines of the deliverables.
The team have wealth of experience in the catalyst ecosystem and look much organized to implement the proposal for real time results.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal well structured and achievable KPIs. The metrics to measure outcomes well thought of standing out. This obviously will make auditing very easy. There is also another important thing highlighted and that's a progress report of the deliverables. These are  what make auditing very easy to be carried out.

f6_assessments.q0: Onboarding East Asian businesses into a Cardano-based tokenization scheme will surely help spread the mass adoption of Cardano, considering above all the population base of the region in question and therefore the potential audience that will be affected by this disruptive mechanism regarding TradFi stock-exchange business models.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are well-known Cardano and Catalyst Community members of the LATAM region, and have co-founded and regularly assisted to the LATAM Town Hall. All of them have LinkedIn profile attached for verification of real/life track records, and this proposal is a follow-up and regional expansion plan based on a previously funded proposal during Fund7. This indicates a clear and deep commitment to the Cardano community and its success, following through on their previously funded proposals.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap, KPIs and success visualization (500 East Asian Active Telegram and Discord Members combined, 50 East Asian investors in Initial Token Offerings and at least 500 visits a month from East Asian Countries in the 3 months following the end of this project) are clear and auditable from a Community perspective. Also, the fact that they have funded proposals from previous Funds indicates they are acquainted with the Catalyst reporting framework. Finally, the fact that part of their strategy is to create sinergies with colleagues from the East Asian Cardano Community indicates that there will be multiple chances for active scrutiny on behalf of other members of the Cardano community during the implementation phase.

f6_assessments.q0:
Great idea. Asia, East Asia is home to a young population, high entrepreneurial spirit, and interest in blockchain and crypto. Many small startups lack capital, making it difficult to bring their ideas to fruition. There are not many crowdfunding platforms because of the legal issues of each country. Crowdfunding platforms like this project are referring to blockchain and cryptocurrency applications, so it will be easier to spread in Asia than normal crowdfunding platforms. This platform, if marketed in the Asian market, will help many small businesses grow, and thereby create a reputation for Cardano. The Cardano community will be much more connected and expanded.
The project has an impact and impact that matches the criteria of the Challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
In this fund 8, the project mainly asks for funding for marketing and introducing the project to East Asian investors.
The project has a detailed implementation plan with specific quantity and implementation time.
The budget is presented in detail, clearly, in accordance with each work item stated in the plan table.
Regarding project development team members, the team has enough experienced and skilled members to develop this project. The experience and skills can be verified by the attached Linkedin information link. The team has 2 members with experience in building ecosystems and building communities, which are very suitable for the work items proposed in this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The implementation roadmap and goals are very clear and detailed. KPIs/progress measurement indicators are set out specifically, with clear expected data. Parameters can be checked based on the website and reported data.

solution: Our business tokenization platform will provide traditional investors access to innovative business investments with Cardano based tokens.
experience: A Strong experience doing digital businesses in LATAM, acquiring unique capabilities & resiliency in complex environments & economic conditions, enables us to understand & adapt to this culturally diverse region. Key factors to generate trust & interest in the East Asian investor
